comments.body:
The value of `state` is actually the same as the value of `this`. You can check by doing a `===` comparison -- they are the same reference.

This is true of all the plugin methods that receive a `state` as their last parameter, including `Visitor`; which seems to be using an incorrect template argument.

It also seems that the `state` type is shared with all visitors being visited during a single `traverse` call (i.e. all plugins share the same state object). I'm not sure it is possible to correctly type it in typescript :/

I wonder what _is_ `this` equivalent to then ü§î 

It's hard to follow in the babel codebase since the `state` is handled inside a closure created by a helper function for creating such closures ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
